completions.nl_description: Move all objects of color B, toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move objects of color B to the position of neighboring objects of color X.
Move all blue 'B' blocks one step down.
Move all objects of color B to the row containing object X.
Move blue objects to the nearest X object maximum distance.
Move all blue objects to the bottom row, keeping their relative positions.
Move all objects of color B that are neighbors of objects of color X, into the positions of those objects of color X.
Move all objects of color B to the bottom row while maintaining their relative columns.
Move all objects of color B if they are neighbors of the object of color X to the position of the object of color X.
Move all blue objects down if they are neighbors of the gray object.
Move all objects of color B to the position of the nearest X, if they are neighbors.
Move all blue objects to the bottom row if they are neighbors of an X object.
Move all blue (B) objects to the rightmost column among the non-X rows.
Move the objects of color B to their neighbors of color X and swap places.
Move all blue objects toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors, and stop just before collision.
Move blue objects to the bottom if they are neighbors of grey objects.
Move all blue objects towards the rightmost column, stopping if they encounter another object.
Move all objects B towards the object X if they are neighbors and replace their positions.
Move all B-colored objects to the nearest X-colored object if they are neighbors, moving them maximally until they hit another object or edge.
Move all non-X objects to the bottom row if they are in the same column as an X in the second bottom row.
Move the blue objects toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of color B to the location of the object of color X if they are neighbors, avoiding overlap.
Move all objects of color B, which are neighbors of object X, toward the nearest object X.
Move all objects of color B to the first occurrence of object X below them if they are in the same column
Move objects B upwards if they are neighbors of object X
Move all objects of color B down one step if they are neighbors of an object of color X.
Move all objects of color B toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of color B towards the object of color X if they are neighbors, until they cannot move further.
Move blue objects to the bottom row, retaining their column positions.
Move all objects of color B to the position of the nearest X object.
Move objects of color B to the position of the center X in the row
Move all blue objects to the row of X objects, retaining their respective column positions.
Move all objects of color B to the bottom row in their respective columns, swapping with X if necessary.
Move all objects of color B one step down.
Move objects of color B towards objects of color X if they are neighbors and place them at the X object positions.
Move all objects of color B one step down if possible, without changing their vertical position if they are already on the bottom row or if the cell below is occupied.
Move all objects of color B to the position directly below the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of color B on the grid, one step toward the nearest X objects.
Move all blue objects to the bottom-most row, keeping their respective columns.
Move all objects of color B toward the center-most object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move blue objects (color B) one step down.
Move the blue objects one step down.
completions.code: (do (rule (vars (this)) (filter (color_equals (color_of this) B)) (apply (move_node down))))

completions.nl_description: Move all objects of color B down to the first available space, without overlapping.
Move all blue objects downwards, without overlapping.
Move all blue objects down and place them in the first empty cell they encounter.
Move objects of color B to the position of object X in front of them.
Move all objects of color B to the first position of color X immediately below them.
Move all blue objects one step down, replacing the closest black object if necessary.
Move all objects of color B to the nearest object's position of color X without overlapping.
Move blue objects of size 1 down until they hit another object
Move elements of color B to the bottom row, retaining their columns.
Move all blue objects to one row below, unless it overlaps another object.
Move all objects of color B to the row above the row that contains at least one X.
Move the objects of color B to the edge or neighbor black object
Move all B objects to the position of X objects if they are neighboring.
Move all objects of color B one step down.
Move all objects of color B, if they are neighbors of an object of color X, to the position of the object of color X pressing it.
Move all blue objects to a neighboring X position if available.
Move all objects of color B one step downward.
Move any blue objects ('B') that neighbor a grey object ('X') to the bottom row of the grid.
Move all blue objects to the row beneath if it contains an 'X'.
Move all objects of color B towards the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move blue objects to the nearest empty cell above them.
Move all objects of size 1 towards objects of color X up to their position.
Move all objects of color B, if they are neighbors of an object of color X, toward the object of color X.
Move all objects of color B to the bottom row in the corresponding column if there is an X in the same column.
Move each object of color B down a step, and then recolor them to the color of the object immediately below.
Move all blue objects until they replace the rightmost black object in their row.
Move all objects of color B to the bottommost row in their respective columns.
Move all objects of color B, toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move the blue objects to the bottom row, keeping their columns unchanged.
Move all the objects of color B down until they hit another object.
Move all blue (B) objects to the bottommost row, without changing their columns and keeping other objects unaffected.
Move all objects of color B toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of color B one step down if they are above the row with X.
Move all blue objects from the second-to-last row to the last row.
Move all objects of color B down if they are neighbors of color X.
Move all objects of color B one step down.
Move objects B one step down.
Move all objects of color B to the topmost row of color X, in the same column.
Move all objects of color B towards the end of the row until they meet an object of color X.
Move all B objects to the bottom row, without specific directions, filling the empty spots first.
Move all blue (B) objects to the bottom row at their respective columns.
Move objects of color B to the position of color X which are their neighbors.
Move all objects of color B toward the object of color X, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all blue objects downward if they are neighbors of an object of color X.
Move blue objects (B) to the second row from bottom, maintaining their columns.
Move all the blue objects to the bottom row, replacing the black objects in that row.
Move all B colored objects towards the X colored object if they are neighbors of it. Ensure they move into the nearest X spot.
Move all blue objects 'B' to the bottom, keeping their columns unchanged.
Move object 'B' to the bottom row if there is an 'X' below them.
Move all objects of color B one step down if they are neighbors of an object of color X.
Move all blue objects to the first row of the X objects.
Move objects of color B to the nearest adjacent X in the same column.
Move all blue objects to the row of Xs.

Move all objects of color B toward color X, while maintaining their columns.
Move all objects of color B down if they are neighbors of objects with color X.
